title: Japanese Chapter 3 Quiz: Basic Greetings & Introductions

questions.question: What does こんにちは mean?
questions.explanation: こんにちは (konnichiwa) is a greeting used during the day.

questions.question: What does おはよう mean?
questions.explanation: おはよう (ohayou) is a greeting used in the morning.

questions.question: What does こんばんは mean?
questions.explanation: こんばんは (konbanwa) is a greeting used in the evening.

questions.question: What does さようなら mean?
questions.explanation: さようなら (sayounara) means "goodbye" in Japanese.

questions.question: What is the particle は used for in Japanese?
questions.explanation: The particle は (wa) marks the topic or subject of the sentence.

questions.question: Form the Japanese sentence "I am Tanaka"
questions.explanation: This is a basic self-introduction using the copula です (desu).

questions.question: What does はじめまして mean?
questions.explanation: はじめまして (hajimemashite) means "nice to meet you" when meeting someone for the first time.

questions.question: Form the Japanese phrase "Nice to meet you, please treat me well"
questions.explanation: This is a polite introduction phrase meaning "Nice to meet you, please treat me well."
questions.correctAnswer: はじめましてよろしくおねがいします

questions.question: What does the copula です mean?
questions.explanation: です (desu) is the polite copula meaning "to be" in Japanese.

questions.question: Form the Japanese sentence "I am a student"
questions.explanation: This is a basic sentence structure using the copula です (desu) to describe what you are.
